main event: An unidentified flying object was tracked on radar and visually observed near Cunningham, Tennessee on 10 August 1956.
interesting points: The object was tracked on radar for 20 minutes without any known aircraft in the area., The object was described as a brilliant light, pulsating in yellow and blue colors., The object reportedly flew straight and steady, with slight oscillation., The apparent speed of the object was noted to be around 600 mph initially, slowing to 300 mph., No sound was heard during the observation, and there were clear weather conditions at the time.
sighted object: one brilliant light, the size of a dinner plate and basketball
